definitions.definition: To make suitable ; to make to correspond ; to fit or suit
To fit by alteration ; to modify or remodel for a different purpose; to adjust
examples: to adapt a story for the stage
to adapt an old machine to a new manufacture

definitions.definition: To make by altering or fitting something else; to produce by change of form or character
examples: to bring out a play adapted from the French
a word of an adapted form

definitions.definition: To make oneself comfortable to a new thing.
examples: They could not adapt to the new climate and so perished.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To make suitable ; to make to correspond ; to fit or suit
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To fit by alteration ; to modify or remodel for a different purpose; to adjust
( transitive ) To make by altering or fitting something else; to produce by change of form or character
( intransitive ) To make oneself comfortable to a new thing.
